title: First look at ‘Lisey’s Story,’ Stephen King series filmed at N.J. house
body: Julianne Moore in "Lisey's Story." Stephen King wrote every episode of the series, which is directed by Pablo Larraín and produced by King, Larraín, Moore and J.J. Abrams. Horror maestro  meets New Jersey in an upcoming limited series from .“,” an adaptation of , stars Oscar winner  and Oscar nominee Clive Owen. The series filmed at the historic  House in , Somerset County in 2019.Apple TV Plus released first-look images from the series Tuesday and announced the premiere date: Friday, June 4.While Stephen King has his hands in many projects, he personally wrote all eight episodes of “Lisey’s Story.”The series is directed by , director of the Jackie O. movie “” and the upcoming "Lisey's Story" filmed at a historic home in Franklin Township.In “Lisey’s Story,” Moore plays Lisey Landon, widow of novelist Scott Landon (Owen). “A series of unsettling events” move Lisey to relive memories from her marriage.Another New Jersey connection can be found in the supporting cast: Emmy winner  (“This Is Us”), who grew up in Paterson. Other actors in the cast include Oscar nominee Jennifer Jason Leigh, Tony winner and Oscar nominee Joan Allen, Dane DeHaan (“A Cure for Wellness”) and Sung Kang (“The Fast and the Furious”).Julianne Moore and Clive Owen in "Lisey's Story."The first two episodes of the series from J. J. Abrams’ Bad Robot Productions and Warner Bros. Television will be released June 4, followed by new episodes each Friday. King, Moore, and Larraín are executive producers.Peter Van Liew first settled the site of the Van Liew-Suydam House in the 1700s and Joseph Suydam built part of the 19th-century Victorian farmhouse used in the series.Paterson's Ron Cephas Jones in "Lisey's Story."The nonprofit  maintains the building, which is located on the top of a hill in the middle of a field at the juncture of , on the edge of Six Mile Run State Park.“I think it’s pretty neat for the town,” township manager Robert Vornlocker Jr. told NJ Advance Media in 2019. “We’re pretty proud of our historic houses so it’d be great to see it on TV. It highlights the beauty of our township.”Here are some more first-look images from the series..Julianne Moore and Joan Allen in the limited series.
